entry.name: sortable
entry.title: Sortable Widget
entry.desc: Reorder elements in a list or grid using the mouse.

longdesc.p: The jQuery UI Sortable plugin makes selected elements sortable by dragging with the mouse.

p.em: Note: In order to sort table rows, the tbody must be made sortable, not the table.

option.name: appendTo
option.desc: Defines where the helper that moves with the mouse is being appended to during the drag (for example, to resolve overlap/zIndex issues).

type.name: jQuery
type.desc: A jQuery object containing the element to append the helper to.

type.name: Element
type.desc: The element to append the helper to.

type.name: Selector
type.desc: A selector specifying which element to append the helper to.

type.name: String
type.desc: The string "parent" will cause the helper to be a sibling of the sortable item.

option.name: axis
option.desc: If defined, the items can be dragged only horizontally or vertically. Possible values: "x", "y".

option.name: cancel
option.desc: Prevents sorting if you start on elements matching the selector.

option.name: connectWith
option.desc: A selector of other sortable elements that the items from this list should be connected to. This is a one-way relationship, if you want the items to be connected in both directions, the connectWith option must be set on both sortable elements.

desc.p: Defines a bounding box that the sortable items are contrained to while dragging.

Note: The element specified for containment must have a calculated width and height (though it need not be explicit). For example, if you have float: left sortable children and specify containment: "parent" be sure to have float: left on the sortable/parent container as well or it will have height: 0, causing undefined behavior.

type.name: Element
type.desc: An element to use as the container.

type.name: Selector
type.desc: A selector specifying an element to use as the container.

type.name: String
type.desc: A string identifying an element to use as the container. Possible values: "parent", "document", "window".

option.name: cursor
option.desc: Defines the cursor that is being shown while sorting.

option.name: cursorAt
option.desc: Moves the sorting element or helper so the cursor always appears to drag from the same position. Coordinates can be given as a hash using a combination of one or two keys: { top, left, right, bottom }.

option.name: delay
option.desc: Time in milliseconds to define when the sorting should start. Adding a delay helps preventing unwanted drags when clicking on an element.

option.name: distance
option.desc: Tolerance, in pixels, for when sorting should start. If specified, sorting will not start until after mouse is dragged beyond distance. Can be used to allow for clicks on elements within a handle.

option.name: dropOnEmpty
option.desc: If false, items from this sortable can't be dropped on an empty connect sortable (see the connectWith option.

option.name: forceHelperSize
option.desc: If true, forces the helper to have a size.

option.name: forcePlaceholderSize
option.desc: If true, forces the placeholder to have a size.

option.name: grid
option.desc: Snaps the sorting element or helper to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [ x, y ].

option.name: handle
option.desc: Restricts sort start click to the specified element.

option.name: helper
option.desc: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display.

type.name: String
type.desc: If set to "clone", then the element will be cloned and the clone will be dragged.

type.name: Function
type.desc: A function that will return a DOMElement to use while dragging. The function receives the event and the element being sorted.

option.name: items
option.desc: Specifies which items inside the element should be sortable.

option.name: opacity
option.desc: Defines the opacity of the helper while sorting. From 0.01 to 1.

option.name: placeholder
option.desc: A class name that gets applied to the otherwise white space.

option.name: revert
option.desc: Whether the sortable items should revert to their new positions using a smooth animation.

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: When set to true, the items will animate with the default duration.

type.name: Number
type.desc: The duration for the animation, in milliseconds.

option.name: scroll
option.desc: If set to true, the page scrolls when coming to an edge.

option.name: scrollSensitivity
option.desc: Defines how near the mouse must be to an edge to start scrolling.

option.name: scrollSpeed
option.desc: The speed at which the window should scroll once the mouse pointer gets within the scrollSensitivity distance.

option.name: tolerance
option.desc:
Specifies which mode to use for testing whether the item being moved is hovering over another item. Possible values:
"intersect": The item overlaps the other item by at least 50%.
"pointer": The mouse pointer overlaps the other item.

option.name: zIndex
option.desc: Z-index for element/helper while being sorted.

method.name: cancel
method.desc: Cancels a change in the current sortable and reverts it to the state prior to when the current sort was started. Useful in the stop and receive callback functions.

method.name: refresh
method.desc: Refresh the sortable items. Triggers the reloading of all sortable items, causing new items to be recognized.

method.name: refreshPositions
method.desc: Refresh the cached positions of the sortable items. Calling this method refreshes the cached item positions of all sortables.

desc.p: Serializes the sortable's item ids into a form/ajax submittable string. Calling this method produces a hash that can be appended to any url to easily submit a new item order back to the server.
It works by default by looking at the id of each item in the format "setname_number", and it spits out a hash like "setname[]=number&setname[]=number".

p.em: Note: If serialize returns an empty string, make sure the id attributes include an underscore. They must be in the form: "set_number" For example, a 3 element list with id attributes "foo_1", "foo_5", "foo_2" will serialize to "foo[]=1&foo[]=5&foo[]=2". You can use an underscore, equal sign or hyphen to separate the set and number. For example "foo=1", "foo-1", and "foo_1" all serialize to "foo[]=1".

property.name: key
property.default: the part of the attribute in front of the separator
property.desc: Replaces part1[] with the specified value.

property.name: attribute
property.desc: The name of the attribute to use for the values.

property.name: expression
property.desc: A regular expression used to split the attribute value into key and value parts.

method.name: toArray
method.desc: Serializes the sortable's item id's into an array of string.
